adj. (-er, -est) 1 a occurring often. B ordinary; without special rank or position. 2 a shared by, coming from, more than one (common knowledge). B belonging to the whole community; public. 3 derog. Low-class; vulgar; inferior. 4 of the most familiar type (common cold). 5 math. Belonging to two or more quantities (common denominator). 6 gram. (of gender) referring to individuals of either sex. n. 1 piece of open public land. 2 slang = *common sense.
n. (pl. -ies) 1 sharing of an attribute. 2 common occurrence. 3 = *commonalty. [var. Of *commonalty]
n. (pl. -ies) 1 the common people. 2 the general body (esp. Of mankind). [medieval latin: related to *common]
n. 1 one of the common people (below the rank of peer). 2 university student without a scholarship. [medieval latin: related to *common]
n. Point or argument accepted by both sides in a dispute.
n. Unwritten law based on custom and precedent.
n. (also common-law wife) partner recognized by common law without formal marriage.
adv. Usually, frequently; ordinarily.
n. European community.
n. Gram. Name denoting a class of objects or a concept, not a particular individual.
adj. Colloq. Ordinary.
n. Gram. Name denoting a class of objects or a concept, not a particular individual.
adj. Colloq. Ordinary.
adj. Lacking originality; trite; ordinary. n. 1 event, topic, etc. That is ordinary or usual. 2 trite remark. [translation of latin locus communis]
n. Room for the social use of students or teachers at a college etc.
n.pl. 1 (the commons) = *house of commons. 2 the common people.
n. Sound practical sense.
adj. Having or marked by common sense.
n. Mus. Four crotchets in a bar.

n. 1 independent state or community, esp. A democratic republic. 2 (the commonwealth) a association of the uk with states that were previously part of the british empire. B republican government of britain 164960. 3 federation of states.
n. Confused and noisy disturbance, uproar. [latin: related to *com-]
adj. 1 shared between members of a group or community; for common use. 2 (of conflict etc.) Between esp. Ethnic or religious communities.
n. 1 group of people sharing accommodation, goods, etc. 2 small district of local government in france etc. [medieval latin: related to *common]
v. (-ning) (usu. Foll. By with) 1 speak intimately. 2 feel in close touch (with nature etc.). [french: related to *common]
adj. (esp. Of a disease) able to be passed on. [latin: related to *communicate]
n. 1 person who receives holy communion. 2 person who imparts information. [related to *communicate]

v. (-ting) 1 impart, transmit (news, heat, motion, feelings, disease, ideas, etc.). 2 succeed in conveying information. 3 (often foll. By with) relate socially; have dealings. 4 be connected (they have communicating rooms).

n. 1 a communicating or being communicated. B information etc. Communicated. C letter, message, etc. 2 connection or means of access. 3 social dealings. 4 (in pl.) Science and practice of transmitting information.
n. Cord or chain pulled to stop a train in an emergency.
n. Artificial satellite used to relay telephone circuits or broadcast programmes.
adj. Ready to talk and impart information.

n. 1 sharing, esp. Of thoughts etc.; fellowship. 2 participation; sharing in common (communion of interests). 3 (communion or holy communion) eucharist. 4 body or group within the christian faith (the methodist communion). [latin: related to *common]
n. Official communication, esp. A news report. [french, = communicated]

n. 1 a social system in which most property is publicly owned and each person works for the common benefit. B political theory advocating this. 2 (usu. Communism) the form of socialist society established in cuba, china, etc., and previously, the ussr. [french: related to *common]
n. 1 person advocating communism. 2 (usu. Communist) supporter of communism or member of a communist party. adj. 1 of or relating to communism. 2 (usu. Communist) of communists or a communist party.
n. Political party advocating communism or communism.

n. (pl. -ies) 1 body of people living in one place, district, or country. 2 body of people having religion, ethnic origin, profession, etc., in common. 3 fellowship (community of interest). 4 commune. 5 joint ownership or liability. [latin: related to *common]
n. Place providing social facilities for a neighbourhood.
n. Tax levied locally on every adult.
n. Tax levied locally on every adult.
the community charge, or poll tax, replaced household rates in 1989-90 and is itself to be replaced by a council tax in 1993.
n. Centre housing young offenders and other juveniles.
n. Unpaid work in the community, esp. By an offender.
n. Singing by a large group, esp. Of old popular songs or hymns.
n. Feeling of belonging to a community, expressed in mutual support etc.

v. (-ting) 1 travel some distance to and from work. 2 (usu. Foll. By to) change (a punishment) to one less severe. 3 (often foll. By into, for) change (one kind of payment or obligation) for another. 4 exchange.
n. Person who commutes to and from work.

adj. 1 closely or neatly packed together. 2 small and economically designed. 3 concise. 4 (of a person) small but well-proportioned. v. Make compact. n. (in full powder compact) small flat case for face-powder.
n. Agreement, contract. [latin: related to *pact]
n. Disc on which information or sound is recorded digitally and reproduced by reflection of laser light.

n. 1 a person who accompanies or associates with another. B (foll. By in, of) partner, sharer. C person employed to live with and assist another. 2 handbook or reference book. 3 thing that matches another. 4 (companion) member of some orders of knighthood. [latin panis bread]
adj. Sociable, friendly.
n. Friendship; being together.
n. Staircase from a ship's deck to the saloon or cabins.

n. (pl. -ies) 1 a number of people assembled. B guest(s). 2 person's associate(s). 3 a commercial business. B partners in this. 4 actors etc. Working together. 5 subdivision of an infantry battalion. 6 body of people combined for a common purpose (the ship's company). 7 being with another or others.
adj. (often foll. By with, to) able or fit to be compared.
use of comparable with to and with corresponds to the senses of compare: to is more common.

adj. 1 perceptible or estimated by comparison; relative (in comparative comfort). 2 of or involving comparison (a comparative study). 3 gram. (of an adjective or adverb) expressing a higher degree of a quality (e.g. Braver, more quickly). n. Gram. Comparative expression or word.

v. (-ring) 1 (usu. Foll. By to) express similarities in; liken. 2 (often foll. By to, with) estimate the similarity of. 3 (often foll. By with) bear comparison. 4 gram. Form comparative and superlative degrees of (an adjective or adverb). n. Literary comparison (beyond compare).
in current use, to and with are generally interchangeable, but with often implies a greater element of formal analysis.

n. 1 comparing. 2 illustration or example of similarity. 3 capacity for being likened (there's no comparison). 4 (in full degrees of comparison) gram. Positive, comparative, and superlative forms of adjectives and adverbs.
n. 1 space within a larger space, separated by partitions. 2 watertight division of a ship. 3 area of activity etc. Kept apart from others in a person's mind. [latin: related to *part]
adj. Of or divided into compartments or categories.
v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) divide into compartments or categories.

n. 1 instrument showing the direction of magnetic north and bearings from it. 2 (usu. In pl.) Instrument for taking measurements and describing circles, with two arms connected at one end by a hinge. 3 circumference or boundary. 4 area, extent; scope; range. [latin passus pace]
n. Pity inclining one to help or be merciful. [church latin: related to *passion]
adj. Showing compassion, sympathetic.
n. Leave granted on grounds of bereavement etc.
adj. 1 a able to coexist; well-suited. B (often foll. By with) consistent. 2 (of equipment etc.) Able to be used in combination.
n. Fellow-countryman. [latin compatriota]
v. (-ll-) 1 force, constrain. 2 arouse irresistibly (compels admiration). 3 (as compelling adj.) Rousing strong interest, conviction, or admiration.
adj. Comprehensive but brief. [latin: related to *compendium]
n. (pl. -s or -dia) 1 concise summary or abridgement. 2 collection of table-games etc. [latin]

v. (-ting) 1 a (often foll. By for) recompense (a person). B recompense (loss, damage, etc.). 2 (usu. Foll. By for a thing) make amends. 3 counterbalance. 4 offset disability or frustration by development in another direction.
n. 1 compensating or being compensated. 2 money etc. Given as recompense.
n. Person who introduces a variety show etc. v. (-ring) act as compre (to). [french, = godfather]
v. (-ting) 1 take part in a contest etc. 2 (often foll. By with, against a person, for a thing) strive. [latin peto seek]
n. (also competency) 1 ability; being competent. 2 income large enough to live on. 3 legal capacity.
adj. 1 adequately qualified or capable. 2 effective.
n. 1 (often foll. By for) competing. 2 event in which people compete. 3 the other people or trade competing; opposition. [latin: related to *compete]
adj. 1 of or involving competition. 2 (of prices etc.) Comparing favourably with those of rivals. 3 having a strong urge to win.
n. Person who competes; rival, esp. In business.
v. (-ling) 1 a collect and arrange (material) into a list, book, etc. B produce (a book etc.) Thus. 2 computing translate (a programming language) into machine code.
n. 1 person who compiles. 2 computing program for translating a programming language into machine code.
adj. Smugly self-satisfied or contented.
complacent is often confused with complaisant.
v. 1 express dissatisfaction. 2 (foll. By of) a say that one is suffering from (an ailment). B state a grievance concerning. 3 creak under strain. [latin plango lament]
n. Plaintiff in certain lawsuits.
n. 1 complaining. 2 grievance, cause of dissatisfaction. 3 ailment. 4 formal accusation.
adj. Formal 1 deferential. 2 willing to please; acquiescent.
complaisant is often confused with complacent.

n. 1 thing that completes; counterpart. 2 full number needed. 3 word(s) added to a verb to complete the predicate of a sentence. 4 amount by which an angle is less than 90. v. 1 complete. 2 form a complement to. [latin compleo fill up]
adj. 1 completing; forming a complement. 2 (of two or more things) complementing each other.
n. Alternative medicine.
adj. 1 having all its parts; entire. 2 finished. 3 total, in every way. v. (-ting) 1 finish. 2 make complete. 3 fill in (a form etc.). 4 conclude the sale or purchase of property.

n. 1 building, series of rooms, etc., made up of related parts (shopping complex). 2 psychol. Group of usu. Repressed feelings or thoughts which cause abnormal behaviour or mental states. 3 preoccupation; feeling of inadequacy. adj. 1 complicated. 2 consisting of related parts; composite.
n. 1 natural colour, texture, and appearance of the skin, esp. Of the face. 2 aspect, character (puts a different complexion on the matter). [latin: related to *complex]
n. 1 obedience to a request, command, etc. 2 capacity to yield.
adj. Obedient; yielding.
v. (-ting) 1 make difficult or complex. 2 (as complicated adj.) Complex; intricate. [latin plico to fold]

n. 1 a involved or confused condition or state. B complicating circumstance; difficulty. 2 (often in pl.) Disease or condition aggravating or arising out of a previous one. [latin: related to *complicate]
n. Partnership in wrongdoing. [french: related to *complex]

n. 1 a polite expression of praise. B act implying praise. 2 (in pl.) A formal greetings accompanying a present etc. B praise. v. (often foll. By on) congratulate; praise. [latin: related to *complement]
adj. 1 expressing a compliment. 2 given free of charge.
n. 1 last of the canonical hours of prayer. 2 service during this. [latin: related to *comply]
v. (-ies, -ied) (often foll. By with) act in accordance (with a request or command). [latin compleo fill up]
n. Part of a larger whole. adj. Being part of a larger whole. [latin: related to *compound1]
v.refl. Literary conduct oneself; behave.

v. (-sing) 1 create in music or writing. 2 constitute; make up. 3 arrange artistically, neatly, or for a specified purpose. 4 a (often refl.) Calm; settle. B (as composed adj.) Calm, self-possessed. 5 printing a set up (type). B arrange (an article etc.) In type.
see note at comprise.
n. Person who composes (esp. Music).
adj. 1 made up of parts. 2 of mixed ionic and corinthian style. 3 (of a plant) having a head of many flowers forming one bloom. n. Composite thing or plant. [latin: related to *compose]

n. 1 a act or method of putting together; composing. B thing composed, esp. Music. 2 constitution of a substance. 3 school essay. 4 arrangement of the parts of a picture etc. 5 compound artificial substance.
n. Person who sets up type for printing. [latin: related to *compose]
adj. Sane. [latin]
n. 1 mixture of decayed organic matter. 2 loam soil with fertilizer for growing plants. v. 1 treat with compost. 2 make into compost. [latin: related to *compose]
n. Tranquil manner. [from *compose]
n. Fruit preserved or cooked in syrup. [french: related to *compose]

n. 1 mixture of two or more things. 2 word made up of two or more existing words. 3 substance formed from two or more elements chemically united in fixed proportions. adj. 1 made up of two or more ingredients or parts. 2 combined; collective. v. 1 mix or combine (ingredients or elements). 2 increase or complicate (difficulties etc.). 3 make up (a composite whole). 4 settle (a matter) by mutual agreement. 5 law condone or conceal (a liability or offence) for personal gain. 6 (usu. Foll. By with) law come to terms with a person. [latin compono -pos- put together]
n. 1 enclosure or fenced-in space. 2 enclosure, esp. In india, china, etc., in which a factory or house stands. [malay kampong]
n. Fracture complicated by a wound.
n. Interest payable on capital and its accumulated interest.
v. 1 grasp mentally; understand. 2 include. [latin comprehendo seize]
adj. That can be understood. [latin: related to *comprehend]
n. 1 a understanding. B text set as a test of understanding. 2 inclusion.
adj. 1 including all or nearly all, inclusive. 2 (of motor insurance) providing protection against most risks. n. (in full comprehensive school) secondary school for children of all abilities.
v. 1 squeeze together. 2 bring into a smaller space or shorter time. n. Pad of lint etc. Pressed on to part of the body to relieve inflammation, stop bleeding, etc.
n. 1 compressing. 2 reduction in volume of the fuel mixture in an internal-combustion engine before ignition.
n. Machine for compressing air or other gases.
v. (-sing) 1 include. 2 consist of. 3 make up, compose. [french: related to *comprehend]
the use of this word in sense 3 is considered incorrect and compose is generally preferred.

n. 1 settlement of a dispute by mutual concession. 2 (often foll. By between) intermediate state between conflicting opinions, actions, etc. v. (-sing) 1 a settle a dispute by mutual concession. B modify one's opinions, demands, etc. 2 bring into disrepute or danger by indiscretion. [latin: related to *promise]
n. Controller (used in the title of some financial officers). [var. Of *controller]
n. 1 compelling or being compelled; obligation. 2 irresistible urge. [latin: related to *compel]
adj. 1 compelling. 2 resulting or acting (as if) from compulsion (compulsive gambler). 3 irresistible (compulsive entertainment).
adj. 1 required by law or a rule. 2 essential.
n. Enforced sale of land or property to a local authority etc.
n. 1 pricking of conscience. 2 slight regret; scruple. [church latin: related to *point]
v. (-ting) 1 reckon or calculate. 2 use a computer.
n. Electronic device for storing and processing data, making calculations, or controlling machinery.
v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 equip with a computer. 2 store, perform, or produce by computer.
adj. Able to use computers.
n. The study of the principles and use of computers.
n. Self-replicating code maliciously introduced into a computer program and intended to corrupt the system or destroy data.
n. 1 associate or companion in some activity. 2 fellow socialist or communist.
slang n. Confidence trick. v. (-nn-) swindle; deceive. [abbreviation]
n. (usu. In pl.) Reason against. prep. & adv. Against (cf. *pro2). [latin contra against]
n. Slang convict. [abbreviation]
v. (us conn) (-nn-) direct the steering of (a ship). [originally cond from french: related to *conduct]
see *com-.
n. Series of linked things or events. [latin catena chain]
adj. Curved like the interior of a circle or sphere.
v. 1 keep secret. 2 hide.
v. (-ding) 1 admit to be true. 2 admit defeat in. 3 grant (a right, privilege, etc.). [latin: related to *cede]
n. 1 personal vanity; pride. 2 literary a far-fetched comparison. B fanciful notion. [from *conceive]
adj. Vain.
adj. Capable of being grasped or imagined.
v. (-ving) 1 become pregnant (with). 2 a (often foll. By of) imagine, think. B (usu. In passive) formulate (a belief, plan, etc.). [latin concipio -cept-]

v. (-ting) 1 (often foll. By on) focus one's attention or thought. 2 bring together to one point. 3 increase the strength of (a liquid etc.) By removing water etc. 4 (as concentrated adj.) Intense, strong. n. Concentrated substance. [latin: related to *centre]
n. 1 concentrating or being concentrated. 2 mental attention. 3 something concentrated. 4 weight of a substance in a given amount of material.
n. Camp where political prisoners etc. Are detained.
adj. Having a common centre.
n. General notion; abstract idea. [latin: related to *conceive]
n. 1 conceiving or being conceived. 2 idea, plan. 3 understanding (has no conception). conceptional adj. [french from latin: related to *concept]
adj. Of mental conceptions or concepts.
v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) form a concept or idea of.

v. 1 a be relevant or important to. B relate to; be about. 2 (refl.; often foll. By with, about, in) interest or involve oneself. 3 worry, affect. n. 1 anxiety, worry. 2 a matter of interest or importance to one. B interest, connection (has a concern in politics). 3 business, firm. 4 colloq. Complicated thing, contrivance. [latin cerno sift]
adj. 1 involved, interested. 2 troubled, anxious.
prep. About, regarding.
n. 1 musical performance of usu. Several separate compositions. 2 agreement. 3 combination of voices or sounds. [italian: related to *concerto]
adj. 1 jointly arranged or planned. 2 mus. Arranged in parts for voices or instruments.
n. Musical instrument like an accordion but smaller. v. (-nas, -naed or -na'd, -naing) compress or collapse in folds like those of a concertina.
n. (pl. -s or -ti) composition for solo instrument(s) and orchestra. [italian]
n. Pitch internationally agreed whereby the a above middle c = 440 hz.
n. 1 a conceding. B thing conceded. 2 reduction in price for a certain category of persons. 3 a right to use land etc. B right to sell goods in a particular territory.
adj. Gram. (of a preposition or conjunction) introducing a phrase or clause which contrasts with the main clause (e.g. In spite of, although). [latin: related to *concede]
n. 1 thick heavy spiral shell of various marine gastropod molluscs. 2 any such gastropod. [latin concha]
n. The study of shells. [from *conch]
n. (esp. In france) door-keeper or porter of a block of flats etc. [french]
v. (-ting) 1 make calm and amenable; pacify; gain the goodwill of. 2 reconcile.
adj. Brief but comprehensive in expression.
n. 1 private meeting. 2 rc ch. A assembly of cardinals for the election of a pope. B meeting-place for this. [latin clavis key]
v. (-ding) 1 bring or come to an end. 2 (often foll. By from or that) infer. 3 settle (a treaty etc.). [latin concludo: related to *close1]
n. 1 ending, end. 2 judgement reached by reasoning. 3 summing-up. 4 settling (of peace etc.). 5 logic proposition reached from given premisses.
adj. Decisive, convincing.
v. 1 make by mixing ingredients. 2 invent (a story, lie, etc.).
adj. (often foll. By with) accompanying; occurring together. n. Accompanying thing.
n. Agreement, harmony.
n. 1 agreement. 2 alphabetical index of words used in a book or by an author. [medieval latin: related to *concord]
n. Agreement, esp. Between the church and a state. [latin: related to *concord]
n. 1 crowd, gathering. 2 large open area in a railway station etc. [latin: related to *concur]

adj. 1 a existing in a material form; real. B specific, definite (concrete evidence; a concrete proposal). 2 gram. (of a noun) denoting a material object as opposed to a quality, state, etc. n. (often attrib.) Mixture of gravel, sand, cement, and water, used for building. v. (-ting) cover with or embed in concrete.
n. 1 hard solid mass. 2 forming of this by coalescence. [latin: related to *concrete]
n. 1 literary or joc. Mistress. 2 (among polygamous peoples) secondary wife.
n. Formal lust.
v. (-rr-) 1 (often foll. By with) have the same opinion. 2 coincide. [latin curro run]
adj. 1 (often foll. By with) existing or in operation at the same time or together. 2 (of three or more lines) meeting at or tending towards one point. 3 agreeing, harmonious.
v. Subject to concussion. [latin quatio shake]
n. 1 temporary unconsciousness or incapacity due to a blow to the head, a fall, etc. 2 violent shaking.

v. 1 express utter disapproval of. 2 a find guilty; convict. B (usu. Foll. By to) sentence to (a punishment). 3 pronounce (a building etc.) Unfit for use. 4 (usu. Foll. By to) doom or assign (to something unpleasant).
n. 1 condensing or being condensed. 2 condensed liquid (esp. Water on a cold surface). 3 abridgement. [latin: related to *condense]
v. (-sing) 1 make denser or more concentrated. 2 express in fewer words. 3 reduce or be reduced from a gas or vapour to a liquid. [latin: related to *dense]
n. Milk thickened by evaporation and sweetened.
n. 1 apparatus or vessel for condensing vapour. 2 electr. = *capacitor. 3 lens or system of lenses for concentrating light.

v. 1 be gracious enough (to do a thing) esp. While showing one's sense of dignity or superiority (condescended to attend). 2 (foll. By to) pretend to be on equal terms with (an inferior). 3 (as condescending adj.) Patronizing.
adj. (of a punishment etc.) Severe and well-deserved. [latin dignus worthy]
n. Seasoning or relish for food. [latin condio pickle]

n. 1 stipulation; thing upon the fulfilment of which something else depends. 2 a state of being or fitness of a person or thing. B ailment, abnormality (heart condition). 3 (in pl.) Circumstances, esp. Those affecting the functioning or existence of something (good working conditions). v. 1 a bring into a good or desired state. B make fit (esp. Dogs or horses). 2 teach or accustom. 3 a impose conditions on. B be essential to.
adj. 1 (often foll. By on) dependent; not absolute; containing a condition. 2 gram. (of a clause, mood, etc.) Expressing a condition.
n. Reflex response to a non-natural stimulus, established by training.
n. Agent that conditions, esp. The hair.
v. (-ling) (foll. By with) express sympathy with (a person) over a loss etc. [latin condoleo grieve with another]
condole is often confused with console1.
n. (often in pl.) Expression of sympathy.
n. Contraceptive sheath worn by men. [origin unknown]
n. 1 joint rule or sovereignty. 2 us building containing individually owned flats. [latin dominium lordship]
v. (-ning) forgive or overlook (an offence or wrongdoing). [latin dono give]
n. Large s. American vulture. [spanish from quechua]
v. (-cing) (foll. By to) contribute to (a result). [latin: related to *conduct]
adj. (often foll. By to) contributing or helping (towards something).

n. 1 behaviour. 2 activity or manner of directing or managing (a business, war, etc.). v. 1 lead or guide. 2 direct or manage (a business etc.). 3 (also absol.) Be the conductor of (an orchestra etc.). 4 transmit (heat, electricity, etc.) By conduction. 5 refl. Behave. [latin duco duct- lead]
n. Power of a specified material to conduct electricity.
n. Transmission of heat, electricity, etc. Through a substance. [latin: related to *conduct]
adj. Transmitting (esp. Heat, electricity, etc.).
n. 1 person who directs an orchestra etc. 2 (fem. Conductress) person who collects fares in a bus etc. 3 thing that conducts heat or electricity. [latin: related to *conduct]
n. 1 channel or pipe conveying liquids. 2 tube or trough protecting insulated electric wires. [medieval latin: related to *conduct]
n. 1 solid figure with a circular (or other curved) plane base, tapering to a point. 2 thing of similar shape. 3 dry fruit of a conifer. 4 ice-cream cornet. [latin from greek]
var. Of *cony.
colloq. n. = confabulation (see *confabulate). v. (-bb-) = *confabulate. [abbreviation]
v. (-ting) converse, chat.
n. Dish or delicacy made with sweet ingredients. [latin conficio prepare]
n. Maker or retailer of confectionery.
n. Confections, esp. Sweets.
n. (pl. -ies) league or alliance, esp. Of confederate states. [french: related to *confederate]

adj. Esp. Polit. Allied. n. 1 ally, esp. (in a bad sense) accomplice. 2 (confederate) supporter of the confederate states. v. (-ting) (often foll. By with) bring or come into alliance. [latin: related to *federal]
n.pl. States which seceded from the us in 18601.
n. 1 union or alliance, esp. Of states. 2 confederating or being confederated.
v. (-rr-) 1 (often foll. By on, upon) grant or bestow. 2 (often foll. By with) converse, consult.
n. 1 consultation. 2 meeting for discussion. [french or medieval latin: related to *confer]
n. Conferring of a degree, honour, etc.

v. 1 a (also absol.) Acknowledge or admit (a fault, crime, etc.). B (foll. By to) admit to. 2 admit reluctantly. 3 a (also absol.) Declare (one's sins) to a priest. B (of a priest) hear the confession of. [latin confiteor -fess-]
adv. By one's own or general admission.
n. 1 a act of confessing. B thing confessed. 2 (in full confession of faith) declaration of one's beliefs or principles.
n. Enclosed stall in a church in which the priest hears confessions. adj. Of confession.
n. Priest who hears confessions and gives spiritual counsel.
n. Small bits of coloured paper thrown by wedding guests at the bride and groom. [italian]
n. (fem. Confidante pronunc. Same) person trusted with knowledge of one's private affairs. [related to *confide]
v. (-ding) 1 (foll. By in) talk confidentially to. 2 (usu. Foll. By to) tell (a secret etc.) In confidence. 3 (foll. By to) entrust (an object of care, a task, etc.) To. [latin confido trust]
n. 1 firm trust. 2 a feeling of reliance or certainty. B sense of self-reliance; boldness. 3 something told as a secret.
n. Swindle in which the victim is persuaded to trust the swindler.
adj. Feeling or showing confidence; bold.
adj. 1 spoken or written in confidence. 2 entrusted with secrets (confidential secretary). 3 confiding.
n. 1 arrangement in a particular form. 2 form or figure resulting from this. 3 computing hardware and its arrangement of connections etc.
v. (-ning) 1 keep or restrict (within certain limits). 2 imprison. n. (usu. In pl.) Limit, boundary. [latin finis limit]
n. 1 confining or being confined. 2 time of childbirth.

v. 1 provide support for the truth or correctness of. 2 (foll. By in) encourage (a person) in (an opinion etc.). 3 establish more firmly (power, possession, etc.). 4 make formally valid. 5 administer the religious rite of confirmation to.
n. 1 confirming or being confirmed. 2 rite confirming a baptized person as a member of the christian church.
adj. Firmly settled in some habit or condition (confirmed bachelor).
v. (-ting) take or seize by authority.
n. Great and destructive fire. [latin: related to *flagrant]
v. (-ting) blend or fuse together (esp. Two variant texts into one).
n. 1 a state of opposition. B fight, struggle. 2 (often foll. By of) clashing of opposed interests etc. v. Clash; be incompatible. [latin fligo flict- strike]
n. 1 place where two rivers meet. 2 a coming together. B crowd of people. [latin fluo flow]
adj. Flowing together, uniting. n. Stream joining another.
v. 1 comply with rules or general custom. 2 (foll. By to, with) comply with; be in accordance with. 3 (often foll. By to) be or make suitable. [latin: related to *form]
adj. 1 (often foll. By to) similar. 2 (often foll. By with) consistent. 3 (often foll. By to) adaptable.
n. Way a thing is formed; shape.
n. Person who conforms to an established practice. adj. Conforming, conventional.
n. 1 accordance with established practice. 2 agreement, suitability.
v. 1 perplex, baffle. 2 confuse (in one's mind). 3 archaic defeat, overthrow. int. Expressing annoyance (confound you!). [latin confundo -fus- mix up]
attrib. Adj. Colloq. Damned.

v. 1 a face in hostility or defiance. B face up to and deal with. 2 (of a difficulty etc.) Present itself to. 3 (foll. By with) bring (a person) face to face with (an accusation etc.). 4 meet or stand facing.
adj. Of confucius or his philosophy.
v. (-sing) 1 perplex, bewilder. 2 mix up in the mind; mistake (one for another). 3 make indistinct (confuse the issue). 4 (often as confused adj.) Throw into disorder.
n. Confusing or being confused.

n. 1 latin-american dance, with a line of dancers one behind the other. 2 tall narrow drum beaten with the hands. v. (congas, congaed or conga'd, congaing) perform the conga. [spanish conga (feminine), = of the congo]
v. 1 make or become semi-solid by cooling. 2 (of blood etc.) Coagulate.
adj. 1 (often foll. By with, to) pleasant because like-minded. 2 (often foll. By to) suited or agreeable.
adj. 1 (esp. Of disease) existing from birth. 2 as such from birth (congenital liar).
n. (in full conger eel) large marine eel. [greek goggros]
n. (pl. Same) disorderly collection; mass, heap. [latin congero heap together]
the form congery, formed under the misapprehension that congeries is plural only, is incorrect.
v. (esp. As congested adj.) Affect with congestion. [latin congero -gest- heap together]
n. Abnormal accumulation or obstruction, esp. Of traffic etc. Or of blood or mucus in part of the body.
adj. Gathered into a rounded mass. n. 1 heterogeneous mass. 2 group or corporation of merged firms. v. (-ting) collect into a coherent mass.
v. (-ting) (often foll. By on) 1 express pleasure at the happiness, good fortune, or excellence of (a person). 2 refl. Think oneself fortunate or clever.
n. 1 congratulating. 2 (usu. In pl.) Expression of this.
v. (-ting) collect or gather into a crowd. [latin grex greg- flock]
n. 1 gathering of people, esp. For religious worship. 2 body of persons regularly attending a particular church etc. [latin: related to *congregate]
adj. 1 of a congregation. 2 (congregational) of or adhering to congregationalism.
n. System whereby individual churches are largely self-governing.
n. 1 formal meeting of delegates for discussion. 2 (congress) national legislative body, esp. Of the us.
n. (fem. Congresswoman) member of the us congress.
adj. 1 (often foll. By with) suitable, agreeing. 2 geom. (of figures) coinciding exactly when superimposed.
adj. Suitable, agreeing; fitting.
adj. Of a cone. [greek: related to *cone]
adj. Cone-shaped.
n. Tree usu. Bearing cones.
adj. Based on conjecture.
n. 1 formation of an opinion on incomplete information; guessing. 2 guess. v. (-ring) guess. [latin conjectura from jacio throw]
v. Formal join, combine.
adj. Formal associated, conjoined.
adj. Of marriage or the relationship of husband and wife. [latin conjux consort]
v. (-ting) 1 gram. List the different forms of (a verb). 2 a unite. B become fused. adj. 1 joined together, paired. 2 fused. [latin jugum yoke]
n. Gram. System of verbal inflection.
adj. Joined together; combined; associated. [latin from juntus joined]

n. 1 joining; connection. 2 gram. Word used to connect clauses or sentences or words in the same clause (e.g. And, but, if). 3 combination (of events or circumstances). 4 apparent proximity to each other of two bodies in the solar system.
n. (pl. -s) mucous membrane covering the front of the eye and the lining inside the eyelids.
adj. 1 serving to join. 2 gram. Of the nature of a conjunction.
n. Inflammation of the conjunctiva.
v. (-ring) 1 perform tricks which are seemingly magical, esp. By movements of the hands. 2 summon (a spirit or demon) to appear. 3
n. (also conjurer) performer of conjuring tricks.
v. (usu. Foll. By out) colloq. 1 (of a machine etc.) Break down. 2 (of a person) become exhausted and give up; fall asleep; faint; die. [origin unknown]
slang n. 1 nose or head. 2 punch on the nose or head. v. Hit on the nose or head. [perhaps = *conch]
n. 1 fruit of the horse chestnut. 2 (in pl.) Children's game played with conkers on strings. [dial. Conker snail-shell]
n. Confidence trickster.
v. (brit. Con) (-nn-) direct the steering of (a ship). [originally cond from french: related to *conduct]

v. 1 (often foll. By to, with) join (two things, or one thing with another). 2 be joined or joinable. 3 (often foll. By with) associate mentally or practically. 4 (foll. By with) (of a train etc.) Be timed to arrive with another, so passengers can transfer. 5 put into communication by telephone. 6 a (usu. In passive; foll. By with) associate with others in relationships etc. B be meaningful or relevant. 7 colloq. Hit or strike effectively. [latin necto nex- bind]
n. Rod between the piston and crankpin etc. In an internal combustion engine.

n. (also connexion) 1 connecting or being connected. 2 point at which two things are connected. 3 link, esp. By telephone. 4 connecting train etc. 5 (often in pl.) Relative or associate, esp. One with influence. 6 relation of ideas.
adj. Connecting, esp. Of body tissue connecting, separating, etc., organs etc.
n. Thing that connects.
n. 1 superstructure of a submarine containing the periscope. 2 armoured wheel-house of a warship. [from *con4]
v. (-ving) 1 (foll. By at) disregard or tacitly consent to (a wrongdoing). 2 (usu. Foll. By with) conspire.
n. (often foll. By of, in) expert judge in matters of taste. [french connatre know]
v. (-ting) 1 (of a word etc.) Imply in addition to the literal or primary meaning. 2 mean, signify.
adj. Of marriage or the relationship of husband and wife. [latin nubo marry]
v. 1 a overcome and control militarily. B be victorious. 2 overcome by effort.
n. 1 conquering or being conquered. 2 a conquered territory. B something won. 3 person whose affection has been won.
adj. Descended from the same ancestor; akin.
n. Moral sense of right and wrong, esp. As affecting behaviour.
n. Sum paid to relieve one's conscience, esp. Regarding a payment previously evaded.
adj. (also conscience-struck) made uneasy by a bad conscience.
adj. Diligent and scrupulous.
n. Person who for reasons of conscience objects to military service etc.

adj. 1 awake and aware of one's surroundings and identity. 2 (usu. Foll. By of or that) aware, knowing. 3 (of actions, emotions, etc.) Realized or recognized by the doer; intentional. 4 (in comb.) Aware of; concerned with (fashion-conscious). n. (prec. By the) the conscious mind.
v. Summon for compulsory state (esp. Military) service. n. Conscripted person.
v. (-ting) 1 make or declare sacred; dedicate formally to religious or divine purpose. 2 (foll. By to) devote to (a purpose).
adj. 1 a following continuously. B in an unbroken or logical order. 2 gram. Expressing a consequence.
n. (often foll. By of; often attrib.) General agreement or opinion. [latin: related to *consent]
v. (often foll. By to) express willingness, give permission, agree. n. Voluntary agreement, permission. [latin sentio feel]
n. 1 result or effect of what has gone before. 2 importance.
adj. 1 (often foll. By on, upon) following as a result or consequence. 2 logically consistent.
adj. 1 consequent; resulting indirectly. 2 important.
adv. & conj. As a result; therefore.
n. (pl. -ies) 1 body controlling a port, river, etc., or preserving the environment. 2 official environmental conservation. [latin: related to *conserve]
n. Preservation, esp. Of the natural environment. [latin: related to *conserve]
n. Supporter of environmental conservation.
n. Principle that the total quantity of energy in any system that is not subject to external action remains constant.

adj. 1 a averse to rapid change. B (of views, taste, etc.) Moderate, avoiding extremes. 2 (of an estimate etc.) Purposely low. 3 (usu. Conservative) of conservatives or the conservative party. 4 tending to conserve. n. 1 conservative person. 2 (usu. Conservative) supporter or member of the conservative party.
n. Political party promoting free enterprise and private ownership.
n. (usu. European) school of music or other arts. [french from italian]

v. 1 contemplate mentally, esp. In order to reach a conclusion. 2 examine the merits of. 3 look attentively at. 4 take into account; show consideration or regard for. 5 (foll. By that) have the opinion. 6 regard as. 7 (as considered adj.) Formed after careful thought (a considered opinion).

adj. Thoughtful towards others; careful not to cause hurt or inconvenience.
n. 1 careful thought. 2 thoughtfulness for others; being considerate. 3 fact or thing taken into account. 4 compensation; payment or reward.

n. 1 consigning or being consigned. 2 goods consigned.

adj. 1 (usu. Foll. By with) compatible or in harmony. 2 (of a person) constant to the same principles.

n. 1 consoling or being consoled. 2 consoling thing or person.

[latin tango tact- touch]

adj. Constantly or frequently recurring; always happening.

continual is often confused with continuous. Continual is used of something that happens very frequently (e.g. There were continual interruptions), while continuous is used of something that happens without a pause (e.g. Continuous rain all day).
n. 1 continuing in existence or operation. 2 duration.
n. 1 continuing or being continued. 2 part that continues something else.

v. (-ues, -ued, -uing) 1 maintain, not stop (an action etc.) (continued to read, reading). 2 (also absol.) Resume or prolong (a narrative, journey, etc.). 3 be a sequel to. 4 remain, stay (will continue as manager; weather continued fine). [latin: related to *contain]
n. (pl. -ies) 1 state of being continuous. 2 a logical sequence. 3 detailed scenario of a film or broadcast. 4 linking of broadcast items.

(-ll-) 1 have control of, regulate. 2 hold in check. 3 check, verify.

v. 1 prepare (food) by heating it. 2 (of food) undergo cooking. 3 colloq. Falsify (accounts etc.). 4 (as be cooking) colloq. Be happening or about to happen. n. Person who cooks, esp. Professionally or in a specified way (a good cook).

attrib. Adj. (of food, meals, etc.) Sold in pre-cooked and refrigerated form.

adj. 1 of or at a fairly low temperature, fairly cold. 2 suggesting or achieving coolness. 3 calm, unexcited. 4 lacking enthusiasm. 5 unfriendly (a cool reception). 6 calmly audacious. 7 (prec. By a) colloq. At least (cost a cool thousand). 8 slang esp. Us marvellous. n. 1 coolness. 2 cool air or place. 3 slang calmness, composure. v. (often foll. By down, off) make or become cool.
n. Cooling agent, esp. Fluid.
n. (also cool-box) insulated container for keeping food cool.
n. 1 vessel in which a thing is cooled. 2 us refrigerator. 3 slang prison cell.

n. Maker or repairer of casks, barrels, etc. [low german or dutch: related to *coop]

(also co-ordinate) v. (-ting) 1 cause (parts, movements, etc.) To function together efficiently. 2 work or act together effectively. adj. Equal in rank or importance. n. 1 math. Each of a system of values used to fix the position of a point, line, or plane. 2 (in pl.) Matching items of clothing.
n. 1 black aquatic bird with a white horny plate on its forehead. 2 colloq. Stupid person. [probably low german]

v. (-ping) (often foll. By with) deal effectively or contend; manage. [french: related to *coup]
n. Priest's long cloaklike vestment. v. (-ping) cover with a cope or coping. [latin cappa *cap]

n. (pl. -ies) 1 thing made to imitate another. 2 single specimen of a publication or issue. 3 material to be printed, esp. Regarded as good etc. Reading matter (the crisis will make exciting copy). v. (-ies, -ied) 1 make a copy of. 2 imitate, do the same as. [latin copia transcript]
n. 1 book containing models of handwriting for learners to imitate. 2 (attrib.) A tritely conventional. B exemplary.
n. Colloq. Person who copies another, esp. Slavishly.

n. Small boat of wickerwork covered with watertight material. [welsh]

n. Seaweed with a hard jointed stem. adj. Of or like coral. [french and italian: related to *coral]

n. Projection of stone, timber, etc., jutting out from a wall to support a weight.

n. 1 a flexible material like thick string, made from twisted strands. B piece of this. 2 similar structure in the body. 3 a ribbed fabric, esp. Corduroy. B (in pl.) Corduroy trousers. 4 electric flex. v. 1 fasten or bind with cord. 2 (as corded adj.) (of cloth) ribbed. [greek khorde string]
adj. 1 heartfelt. 2 friendly. n. Fruit-flavoured drink.
n. Smokeless explosive. [from *cord, because of its appearance]
adj. (of a hand-held electrical device) usable without a power cable because working from an internal source of energy or battery.

n. 1 line or circle of police, soldiers, guards, etc., esp. Preventing access. 2 ornamental cord or braid. 3 fruit-tree trained to grow as a single stem. v. (often foll. By off) enclose or separate with a cordon of police etc. [italian and french: related to *cord]
cookery adj. Of the highest class. n. Cook of this class. [french]
n. 1 guarded line between infected and uninfected districts. 2 measure designed to prevent the spread of undesirable influences.
n. 1 thick cotton fabric with velvety ribs. 2 (in pl.) Corduroy trousers. [cord = ribbed fabric]

n. 1 horny central part of certain fruits, containing the seeds. 2 central or most important part of anything (also attrib.: core curriculum). 3 inner central region of the earth. 4 part of a nuclear reactor containing fissile material. 5 hist. Structural unit in a computer, storing one bit of data (see *bit4). 6 inner strand of an electric cable. 7 piece of soft iron forming the centre of an electromagnet or induction coil. v. (-ring) remove the core from.
n. Person cited in a divorce case as having committed adultery with the respondent.
n. (pl. -s) dog of a short-legged breed with a foxlike head. [welsh]
n. 1 aromatic plant. 2 its seeds used for flavouring. [greek koriannon]
adj. 1 of ancient corinth in southern greece. 2 archit. Of the order characterized by ornate decoration and acanthus leaves. [latin from greek]

n. 1 buoyant light-brown bark of a s. European oak. 2 bottle-stopper of cork etc. 3 float of cork. 4 (attrib.) Made of cork. v. (often foll. By up) 1 stop or confine. 2 restrain (feelings etc.). [spanish alcorque]
n. Charge made by a restaurant etc. For serving a customer's own wine etc.
adj. 1 stopped with a cork. 2 (of wine) spoilt by a decayed cork.

n. Diving sea bird with black plumage. [latin corvus marinus sea-raven]

Definitions: Corn1 n. 1 a cereal before or after harvesting, esp. The chief crop of a region. B grain or seed of a cereal plant. 2 colloq. Something corny or trite. [old english]
n. Small tender area of horny skin, esp. On the toe. [latin cornu horn]

n. 1 place where converging sides or edges meet. 2 projecting angle, esp. Where two streets meet. 3 internal space or recess formed by the meeting of two sides, esp. Of a room. 4 difficult position, esp. One with no escape. 5 secluded place. 6 region or quarter, esp. A remote one. 7 action or result of buying or controlling the whole stock of a commodity. 8 boxing & wrestling corner of the ring where a contestant rests between rounds. 9 football & hockey free kick or hit from the corner of a pitch. v. 1 force into a difficult or inescapable position. 2 establish a corner in (a commodity). 3 (esp. Of or in a vehicle) go round a corner. [latin: related to *corn2]
n. 1 a stone in the projecting angle of a wall. B foundation-stone. 2 indispensable part or basis.

n. (pl. -nae) 1 a halo round the sun or moon. B gaseous envelope of the sun, seen as an area of light around the moon during a total solar eclipse. 2 anat. Crownlike structure. 3 crownlike outgrowth from the inner side of a corolla. 4 glow around an electric conductor.
adj. Anat. Resembling or encircling like a crown. n. (pl. -ies) = *coronary thrombosis. [latin: related to *corona]

adj. 1 true, accurate. 2 proper, in accordance with taste or a standard. v. 1 set right; amend. 2 mark errors in. 3 substitute a right thing for (a wrong one). 4 a admonish (a person). B punish (a person or fault). 5 counteract (a harmful quality). 6 adjust (an instrument etc.).

n. 1 advice, esp. Formally given. 2 consultation for advice. 3 (pl. Same) legal adviser, esp. A barrister; body of these. v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 advise (a person). 2 give esp. Professional advice to (a person) on personal problems. 3 recommend (a course of action).
n. (us counselor) 1 adviser. 2 person giving professional guidance on personal problems. 3 us barrister.

v. 1 determine the total number of, esp. By assigning successive numbers. 2 repeat numbers in ascending order. 3 (often foll. By in) include or be included in one's reckoning or plan. 4 consider or regard to be (lucky etc.). 5 (often foll. By for) have value; matter (my opinion counts for little). n. 1 a counting or being counted. B total of reckoning. 2 law each charge in an indictment.
n. Foreign noble corresponding to an earl. [latin comes companion]

n. 1 onward movement or progression. 2 direction taken (changed course). 3 stretch of land or water for races; golf-course. 4 series of lessons etc. In a particular subject. 5 each successive part of a meal. 6 sequence of medical treatment etc. 7 line of conduct. 8 continuous horizontal layer of masonry, brick, etc. 9 channel in which water flows. v. n. 1 (in full court of law) a judicial body hearing legal cases. B = *courtroom. 2 quadrangular area for games (tennis-court; squash-court). 3 a yard surrounded by houses with entry from the street. C assembly held by a sovereign; state reception. 5 attention paid to a person whose favour etc. Is sought (paid court to her). v. 1 a try to win affection or favour of. B pay amorous attention to. 2 seek to win (applause, fame, etc.). 3 invite (misfortune) by one's actions.

v. 1 (often foll. By with) protect or conceal with a cloth, lid, etc. 2 a extend over; occupy the whole surface of. B (often foll. By with) strew thickly or thoroughly. Wearing a hat; having a roof. 4 include; comprise; deal with. 5 travel (a specified distance). 6 describe as a reporter. 7 be enough to defray (20 should cover it). 8 a refl. Take measures to protect oneself. B (absol.; foll. By for) stand in for. 9 a aim a gun etc. At. B (of a fortress, guns, etc.) Command (territory). C protect (an exposed person etc.) By being able to return fire. 10 a esp. Cricket stand behind (another player) to stop any missed balls. B mark (an opposing player). 11 (of a stallion etc.) Copulate with. n. 1 thing that covers, esp.: a lid. B book's binding. C either board of this. D envelope or wrapping (under separate cover). 2 shelter. 3 a pretence; screen. B pretended identity. C mil. Supporting force protecting an advance party from attack. 4 a funds, esp. Obtainable from insurance to meet a liability or secure against loss. B insurance protection (third-party cover). 5 person acting as a substitute. 6 place-setting at table. 7 cricket = *cover-point.

Attempt. 6 slang crystalline form of cocaine broken into small pieces. v. 1 break without separating the parts. 2 make or cause to make a sharp explosive sound. 3 break with a sharp sound. 4 give way or cause to give way (under torture etc.). 5 (of the voice) change pitch sharply; break. 6 colloq. Find the solution to. 7 tell (a joke etc.). 8 colloq. Hit sharply. 9 (as cracked adj.) Crazy. 10 break (wheat) into coarse pieces. attrib. Adj. Colloq. Excellent; first-rate (crack shot).

By into) collide or fall, or cause (a vehicle etc.) To collide or fall, violently; overturn at high speed. 4 collapse financially. 5 colloq. Gatecrash. 6 computing (of a machine or system) fail suddenly. 7 colloq. Pass (a red traffic-light etc.). 8 (often foll. By out) slang sleep, esp. B (of a nuclear reactor) maintaining a self-sustaining chain reaction.

Two short intersecting lines (+ or x). 5 cross-shaped military etc. Decoration. 6 a hybrid. B crossing of breeds etc. 7 (foll. By between) mixture of two things. 8
n. Horizontal bar, esp. That on a man's bicycle.

Come aggressively close to.

n. 1 monarch's jewelled headdress. 2 (the crown) a monarch as head of state. B power or authority of the monarchy. 3 a wreath for the head as an emblem of victory. B award or distinction, esp. In sport. 4 crown-shaped ornament etc. 5 top part of the head, a hat, etc. 6 a highest or central part (crown of the road). B thing that completes or forms a summit. 7 a part of a tooth visible outside the gum. B artificial replacement for this. 8 former british coin worth five shillings. v. 1 put a crown on (a person or head). 2 invest with a royal crown or authority. 3 be a crown to; rest on top of. 4 a (often as crowning adj.) (cause to) be the reward, summit, or finishing touch to (crowning glory). B bring to a happy outcome. 5 fit a crown to (a tooth). 6 slang hit on the head. 7 promote (a piece in draughts) to king. [latin corona]
n. British colony controlled by the crown.

billiards etc. n. Long rod for striking a ball. v. (cues, cued, cueing or cuing) strike (a ball) with or use a cue. [var. Of *queue]

n.pl. (also treated as sing., although the singular form is strictly datum) 1 known facts used for inference or in reckoning. 2 quantities or characters operated on by a computer etc. [latin data from do give]

(1) in scientific, philosophical, and general use, this word is usually considered to denote a number of items and is thus treated as plural with datum as the singular. (2) in computing and allied subjects (and sometimes in general use), it is treated as a mass (or collective) noun and used with words like this, that, and much, with singular verbs, e.g. Useful data has been collected. Some people consider use (2) to be incorrect but it is more common than use (1). However, data is not a singular countable noun and cannot be preceded by a, every, each, either, or neither, or be given a plural form datas.
n. Store or source of data.
n. Structured set of data held in a computer.
adj. (often foll. By to) capable of being dated.

adj. 1 no longer alive. 2 colloq. Extremely tired or unwell. 3 numb (fingers are dead). 4 (foll. By to) insensitive to. 5 no longer effective or in use; extinct. 6 (of a match, coal, etc.) Extinguished. 7 inanimate. 8 a lacking force or vigour. B (of sound) not resonant. 9 quiet; lacking activity (dead season). 10 (of a microphone, telephone, etc.) Not transmitting sounds. 11 (of a ball in a game) out of play. 12 abrupt, complete (come to a dead stop; a dead calm; dead certainty). adv. 1 absolutely, completely (dead on target; dead tired). 2 colloq. Very, extremely (dead easy). n. Time of silence or inactivity (dead of night).

n. Colloq. Derelict, tramp.

n. 1 race in which competitors tie. 2 result of such a race.

n. Time-limit.
n. 1 state of unresolved conflict. 2 lock requiring a key to open or close it. v. Bring or come to a standstill.

v. (past and past part. Dealt) 1 (foll. By with) a take measures to resolve, placate, etc. B do business with; associate with. C discuss or treat (a subject). 2 (often foll. By by, with) behave in specified way (dealt honourably by them). 3 (foll. By in) sell (deals in insurance). 4 (often foll. By out, round) distribute to several people etc. 5 (also absol.) Distribute (cards) to players. 6 administer (was dealt a blow). 7 assign, esp. Providentially (were dealt much happiness). n. 1 (usu. A good or great deal) colloq. A large amount (good deal of trouble). B considerably (great deal better). 2 colloq. Business arrangement; transaction. 3 specified treatment (a rough deal). 4 a dealing of cards. B player's turn to do this. [old english]

n. 1 a head of the chapter of a cathedral or collegiate church. B (usu. Rural dean) clergyman supervising parochial clergy. 2 a college or university official with disciplinary and advisory functions. B head of a university faculty or department or of a medical school. [latin decanus]
var. Of *dene.

adj. 1 a beloved or much esteemed. B as a merely polite or ironic form (my dear man). 2 as a formula of address, esp. Beginning a letter (dear sir). 3 (often foll. By to) precious; cherished. 4 (usu. By into) put a hand, ladle, etc., into (a container) to take something out. B use part of (one's resources) (dipped into our savings). 7 lower or be lowered, esp. In salute. 8 lower the beam of (headlights) to reduce dazzle. 9 colour (a fabric) by immersing it in dye. 10 wash (sheep) in disinfectant. n. 1 dipping or being dipped. 2 liquid for dipping.

adj. 1 extending or moving in a straight line or by the shortest route; not crooked or circuitous. 2 straightforward; frank. 3 with nothing or no-one in between; personal (direct line). 4 (of descent) lineal, not collateral. 5 complete, greatest possible (the direct opposite). adv. 1 in a direct way or manner (dealt with them direct). 2 by the direct route (sent direct to london). v. 1 control; govern or guide (duty directs me). 2 (foll. By to + infin., or that + clause) order (a person) to. 3 (foll. By to) a address (a letter etc.). B tell or show (a person) the way to (a place). 4 (foll. By at, to, towards) point, aim, or turn (a blow, attention, or remark). 5 (also absol.) Supervise the performing, staging, etc., of (a film, play, etc.).

(-ier, -iest) 1 soiled, unclean. 2 causing dirtiness (dirty job). 3 sordid, lewd, obscene. 4 unpleasant, dishonourable, unfair (dirty trick). 5 (of weather) rough, squally. 6 (of colour) muddied, dingy. adv. v. 1 pull or twist out of shape. 2 misrepresent (facts etc.). 3 transmit (sound etc.) Inaccurately.

v. 1 (often foll. By from) draw away the attention of. 2 bewilder, perplex. 3 (as distracted adj.) Confused, mad, or angry. 4 amuse, esp. To divert from pain etc. [latin: related to *dis-, traho tract- draw]
n. 1 a distracting or being distracted. B thing that distracts. 2 relaxation; amusement. 3 confusion; frenzy, madness.
v. (usu. Foll. By upon) impose distraint (on a person, goods, etc.). [latin: related to *dis-, stringo strict- draw tight]
n. Seizure of goods to enforce payment.
adj. (fem. Distraite) inattentive; distraught. [french: related to *distract]
adj. Distracted with worry, fear, etc.; extremely agitated. [related to *distrait]
n. 1 anguish or suffering caused by pain, sorrow, worry, etc. 2 poverty. 3 law = *distraint. v. Cause distress to, make unhappy.
adj. 1 suffering from distress. 2 impoverished. 3 (of furniture, clothing, etc.) Aged, torn, etc. Artificially.
n. Region of high unemployment and poverty.
v. (-ting) 1 give shares of; deal out. 2 scatter; put at different points. 3 arrange; classify. [latin tribuo -but- assign]
the second pronunciation given, with the stress on the first syllable, is considered incorrect by some people.
the second pronunciation given, with the stress on the first syllable, is considered incorrect by some people.
n. 1 distributing or being distributed. 2 a commercial dispersal of goods etc. B extent to which different classes etc. Share in a nation's total wealth etc.
adj. 1 of or produced by distribution. 2 logic & gram. Referring to each individual of a class, not to the class collectively (e.g. Each, either). n. Gram. Distributive word.
n. 1 person or thing that distributes, esp. Goods. 2 device in an internal-combustion engine for passing current to each spark-plug in turn.

n. 1 (often attrib.) Area regarded as a geographical or administrative unit (the peak district; postal district; wine-growing district). 2 administrative division of a county etc. [latin: related to *distrain]
n. (in the us) prosecuting officer of a district.
n. Nurse who makes home visits in an area.
n. Lack of trust; suspicion. v. Have no trust in.

v. 1 break the rest, calm, or quiet of. 2 agitate; worry. 3 move from a settled position (disturbed my papers). 4 (as disturbed adj.) Emotionally or mentally unstable. [latin: related to *dis-, turba tumult]
n. 1 disturbing or being disturbed. 2 tumult; uproar; agitation.
n. Lack of union; separation; dissension.
v. (-ting) 1 remove the unity from. 2 separate.
n. Disused state. v. (-sing) cease to use.
n. (also dissyllable) prosody word or metrical foot of two syllables.
n. Long narrow excavation esp. For drainage or as a boundary. v. 1 make or repair ditches (hedging and ditching). 2 slang abandon; discard.
v. 1 hesitate; be indecisive. 2 tremble; quiver. n. Colloq. State of agitation or hesitation.
n. 1 wild choral hymn in ancient greece. 2 passionate or inflated poem etc.
n. (pl. -s) 1 (in accounts, inventories, etc.) The aforesaid, the same. 2 colloq. (used to avoid repetition) the same (came late today and ditto yesterday). [latin *dictum]
in sense 1, the word ditto is often replaced by " under the word or sum to be repeated.
n.pl. Inverted commas etc. Representing ditto.
n. (pl. -ies) short simple song. [latin: related to *dictate]
adj. Causing increased output of urine. n. Diuretic drug. [greek: related to *dia-, oureo urinate]
adj. 1 of the day or daytime. 2 daily. 3 occupying one day.
n. (pl. -s) great woman opera singer; prima donna. [italian from latin, = goddess]
adj. Chem. Having a valency of two.
n. Low couch or bed without a back or ends. [ultimately from persian divan bench]

v. (-ving) 1 plunge head first into water. 2 a (of an aircraft, person, etc.) Plunge steeply downwards. B (of a submarine) submerge; go deeper. 3 (foll. By into) colloq. A put one's hand into (a pocket, handbag, etc.). B become enthusiastic about (a subject, meal, etc.). 4 move suddenly (dived into a shop). n. 1 act of diving; plunge. 2 steep descent or fall. 3 colloq. Disreputable nightclub, bar, etc. [old english]
v. Bomb (a target) from a diving aircraft.
n. 1 person who dives, esp. Working under water. 2 diving bird.
v. (-ging) 1 a spread out from a central point, become dispersed. B take different courses (their interests diverged). 2 a (often foll. By from) depart from a set course.
adj. Archaic various; several. [latin: related to *diverse]
adj. Varied. [latin: related to *di-2, verto vers- turn]
v. (-ies, -ied) 1 make diverse; vary. 2 spread (investment) over several enterprises. 3 (often foll. By into) expand one's range of products.
n. 1 diverting or being diverted. 2 a diverting of attention. B stratagem for this. 3 recreation, pastime. 4 alternative route when a road is temporarily closed.
n. Variety.
v. 1 a turn aside; deflect. B distract (attention). 2 (often as diverting adj.) Entertain; amuse. [latin: related to *diverse]
v. (usu. Foll. By of) 1 unclothe; strip. 2 deprive, rid. [latin: related to *vest]

v. (-ding) 1 (often foll. By in, into) separate into parts; break up; split. 2 (often foll. By out) distribute; deal; share. 3 a separate (one thing) from another. B classify into parts or groups. 4 cause to disagree. 5 a find how many times (a number) contains or is contained in another (divide 20 by 4; divide 4 into 20). B (of a number) be contained in (a number) without remainder (4 divides into 20). 6 parl. Vote (by members entering either of two lobbies) (the house divided). n. 1 dividing line. 2 watershed. [latin divido -vis-]
n. 1 share of profits paid to shareholders or to winners in a football pool etc. 2 number to be divided. 3 benefit from an action. [anglo-french: related to *divide]
n. 1 screen etc. Dividing a room. 2 (in pl.) Measuring-compasses.
n. Supposed supernatural insight into the future etc. [latin: related to *divine]

adj. (diviner, divinest) 1 a of, from, or like god or a god. B sacred. 2 colloq. Excellent; delightful. v. (-ning) 1 discover by intuition or guessing. 2 foresee. 3 practise divination. n. Theologian or clergyman.
n. Person who practises divination.
n. Open-bottomed enclosure, supplied with air, for descent into deep water.
n. Elevated board for diving from.
n. Watertight suit, usu. With helmet and air-supply, for work under water.
n. = *dowsing-rod.
n. (pl. -ies) 1 being divine. 2 god; godhead. 3 theology.
adj. Capable of being divided.

n. 1 dividing or being divided. 2 dividing one number by another. 3 disagreement (division of opinion). 4 parl. Separation of members for counting votes. 5 one of two or more parts into which a thing is divided. 6 unit of administration, esp. A group of army brigades, regiments, or teams in a sporting league.
n. Sign () indicating that one quantity is to be divided by another.
adj. Causing disagreement.
n. Number by which another is divided.

n. 1 legal dissolution of a marriage. 2 separation (divorce between thought and feeling). v. (-cing) 1 a (usu. As divorced adj.) (often foll. By from) legally dissolve the marriage of. B separate by divorce. C end one's marriage with. 2 separate (divorced from reality). [latin: related to *diverse]
n. Divorced person.
n. Piece of turf cut out by a blow, esp. By the head of a golf club. [origin unknown]
v. (-ging) disclose, reveal (a secret etc.).
colloq. n. (pl. -ies) dividend. v. (-ies, -ied) (often foll. By up) share out. [abbreviation]
colloq. n. (pl. -ies) dividend. v. (-ies, -ied) (often foll. By up) share out. [abbreviation]
n. Hindu and jainist festival with illuminations, held between september and november. [sanskrit dipa lamp]
n. Southern states of the us. [origin uncertain]
n. Large iron cooking-pot used by campers etc. [hindustani from persian]
n. 1 = *dixie. 2 traditional kind of jazz.
abbr. Do-it-yourself.
adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 a giddy. B feeling confused. 2 causing giddiness. v. (-ies, -ied) 1 make dizzy. 2 bewilder.
abbr. 1 dinner-jacket. 2 disc jockey.
n. (also jellaba) loose hooded cloak (as) worn by arab men. [arabic]
abbr. Decilitre(s).
n. Lowest layer of the ionosphere. [d arbitrary]
Abbr. Doctor of letters. [latin doctor litterarum]
abbr. Deutschmark.
abbr. Decimetre(s).
Abbr. Doctor of music.
abbr. Deoxyribonucleic acid, esp. Carrying genetic information in chromosomes.
n. Government notice to news editors not to publish certain items for security reasons. [defence, *notice]

v. (3 sing. Pres. Does; past did; past part. Done; pres. Part. Doing) 1 perform, carry out, achieve, complete (work etc.) (did his homework; a lot to do). 2 produce, make, provide (doing a painting; we do lunches). 3 grant; impart (does you good; do me a favour). 4 act, behave, proceed (do as i do; would do well to wait). 5 work at (do carpentry; do chemistry). 6 be suitable or acceptable; satisfy (will never do; will do me nicely). 7 deal with; attend to (do one's hair). 8 fare; get on (did badly in the test). 9 solve; work out (did the sum). 10 a traverse (a certain distance) (did 50 miles today). B travel at a specified speed (was doing eighty). 11 colloq. Act or behave like; play the part of. 12 produce (a play, opera, etc.) (will do shakespeare). 13 a colloq. Finish (i've done in the garden). B (as done adj.) Be finished (day is done). 14 cook, esp. Completely (do it in the oven; potatoes aren't done). 15 be in progress (what's doing?). 16 colloq. Visit (did the museums). 17 colloq. A (often as done adj.) Exhaust; tire out. B defeat, kill, ruin. 18 (foll. By into) translate or transform. 19 colloq. Cater for (they do one very well here). 20 slang a rob (did a big bank). B swindle. 21 slang prosecute, convict (done for shoplifting). 22 slang undergo (a term of imprisonment). 23 slang take (an illegal drug). v.aux. 1 in questions and negative statements or commands (do you understand?; i don't smoke; don't be silly). 2 ellipt. Or in place of a verb (you know her better than i do; i wanted to go and i did; tell me, do!). 3 for emphasis (i do want to; do tell me; they did go). 4 in inversion (rarely does it happen). n. (pl. Dos or do's) colloq. Elaborate party, operation, etc.
abbr. Department of the environment.
n. (pl. Same or -s) female fallow deer, reindeer, hare, or rabbit. [old english]
n. 1 person who does something. 2 person who acts rather than theorizing.
see *do1.
contr. Does not.
v. Remove (a hat or clothes). [from do off]

n. 1 four-legged flesh-eating animal akin to the fox and wolf, and of many breeds. 2 male of this, or of the fox or wolf. 3 colloq. A despicable person. B person of a specified kind (lucky dog). 4 mechanical device for gripping. 5 (in pl.; prec. By the) colloq. Greyhound-racing. v. (-gg-) follow closely; pursue, track.
n. Two-wheeled driving-cart with cross seats back to back.
n. 1 collar for a dog. 2 colloq. Clerical collar.

adj. 1 of or like a dog. 2 devoted to dogs. n. (also doggie) (pl. -ies) pet name for a dog.

n. Us & austral. Dog's kennel.

n. 1 principle, tenet, or system of these, esp. Of a church or political party. 2 arrogant declaration of opinion. [greek, = opinion]

v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 speak dogmatically. 2 express (a principle etc.) As dogma.

pres. Part. Of *do1. n. 1 a action (famous for his doings). B effort (takes a lot of doing). 2 (in pl.) Slang unspecified things (have we got all the doings?).
n. Slang attack, beating-up.
adj. (of work) done or to be done by a householder etc. n. Such work.

n.pl. (usu. Prec. By the) 1 low spirits. 2 period of inactivity. 3 equatorial ocean region with little or no wind. [perhaps after dull, tantrum]

adj. 1 mournful, sad. 2 dreary, dismal.

n. 1 small model of esp. A baby or child as a child's toy. 2 colloq. A pretty but silly young woman. B attractive woman. 3 ventriloquist's dummy. v. (foll. By up) colloq. Dress smartly. [pet form of dorothy]

n. (pl. -ies) 1 child's name for a doll. 2 movable platform for a cine-camera etc. 3 easy catch in cricket.
n. Colloq. Attractive and stylish young woman.

n. 1 area under one rule; realm. 2 estate etc. Under one control. 3 sphere of control or influence. [french: related to *demesne]
n. 1 rounded (usu. Hemispherical) vault forming a roof. 2 dome-shaped thing. v. (-ming) (usu. As domed adj.) Cover with or shape as a dome. [latin domus house]
adj. 1 of the home, household, or family affairs. 2 of one's own country. 3 (of an animal) tamed, not wild. 4 fond of home life. n. Household servant.

n. 1 dwelling-place. 2 law a place of permanent residence. B residing. v. (-ling) (usu. As domiciled adj.) (usu. Foll. By at, in) settle in a place. [latin domus home]
adj. Formal (esp. Of a doctor's etc. Visit) to, at, or of a person's home. [medieval latin: related to *domicile]
adj. 1 dominating, prevailing. 2 (of an inherited characteristic) appearing in offspring even when the opposite characteristic is also inherited. n. Mus. Fifth note of the diatonic scale of any key.
v. (-ting) 1 command, control. 2 be the most influential or obvious. 3 (of a high place) overlook.

n. 1 university teacher, esp. A senior member of a college at oxford or cambridge. 2 (don) spanish title prefixed to a forename. [spanish from latin dominus lord]

adj. 1 completed. 2 cooked. 3 colloq. Socially acceptable (the done thing). 4 (often with in) colloq. Tired out. 5 (esp. As int. In reply to an offer etc.) Accepted.

v. (-ling) scribble or draw, esp. Absent-mindedly. n. Such a scribble or drawing. [originally = foolish person]
n. 1 a grim fate or destiny. B death or ruin. 2 condemnation. v. 1 (usu. Foll. By to) condemn or destine. 2 (esp. As doomed adj.) Consign to misfortune or destruction. [old english, = *statute]
n. Day of the last judgement.

n. 1 a esp. Hinged barrier for closing and opening the entrance to a building, room, cupboard, etc. B this as representing a house etc. (lives two doors away). 2 a entrance or exit; doorway. B means of access.

n. 1 step or area in front of the outer door of a house etc. 2 slang thick slice of bread. v. Colloq. 1 go from door to door canvassing, selling, etc. 2 call upon or wait on the doorstep for (a person) in order to interview etc.
n. Device for keeping a door open or to prevent it from striking the wall.

n. 1 a slang narcotic. B drug etc. Given to a horse, athlete, etc., to improve performance. 2 thick liquid used as a lubricant etc. 3 varnish. 4 slang stupid person. 5 slang information. v.
adj. (also dopy) (dopier, dopiest) colloq. 1 half asleep or stupefied as if by a drug. 2 stupid.

adv. 1 into or towards a lower place, esp. To the ground (fall down). 2 in a lower place or position (blinds were down). 3 to or in a place regarded as lower, esp.: a southwards. B away from a major city or a university. 4 a in or into a low or weaker position or condition (hit a man when he's down; down with a cold). B losing by (three goals down; 5 down). C (of a computer system) out of action. 5 from an earlier to a later time (down to 1600). 6 to a finer or thinner consistency or smaller amount or size (grind down; water down; boil down). 7 cheaper (bread is down; shares are down). 8 into a more settled state (calm down). 9 in writing or recorded form (copy it down; down on tape; down to speak next). 10 paid or dealt with as a deposit or part (5 down, 20 to pay; three down, six to go). 11 with the current or wind. 12 (of a crossword clue or answer) read vertically (five down). prep. 1 downwards along, through, or into. 2 from the top to the bottom of. 3 along (walk down the road). 4 at or in a lower part of (lives down the road). attrib. Adj. 1 directed downwards (a down draught). 2 from a capital or centre (down train; down platform). v. Colloq. 1 knock or bring down. 2 swallow. n. 1 act of putting down. 2 reverse of fortune (ups and downs). 3 colloq.

v. (-ving; past drove; past part. Driven) 1 urge forward, esp. Forcibly. 2 a compel (was driven to complain). B force into a specified state (drove him mad). C (often refl.) Urge to overwork. 3 a operate and direct (a vehicle, locomotive, etc.). B convey or be conveyed in a vehicle. C be competent to drive (a vehicle) (does he drive?). D travel in a private vehicle. 4 (of wind etc.) Carry along, propel, esp. Rapidly (driven snow; driving rain). 5 a (often foll. By into) force (a stake, nail, etc.) Into place by blows. B bore (a tunnel etc.). 6 effect or conclude forcibly (drove a hard bargain; drove his point home). 7 (of power) operate (machinery). 8 (usu. Foll. By at) work hard; dash, rush. 9 hit (a ball) forcibly. n. 1 journey or excursion in a vehicle. 2 a (esp. Scenic) street or road. B private road through a garden to a house. 3 a motivation and energy. B inner urge (sex-drive). 4 forcible stroke of a bat etc. 5 organized effort (membership drive). 6 a transmission of power to machinery, wheels, etc. B position of the steering-wheel in a vehicle (left-hand drive). C computing = *disk drive. 7 organized whist, bingo, etc. Competition.

n. 1 a globule of liquid that hangs, falls, or adheres to a surface. B very small amount of liquid (just a drop left). C glass etc. Of alcohol. 2 a abrupt fall or slope. B amount of this (drop of fifteen feet). C act of dropping. D fall in prices, temperature, etc. E deterioration (drop in status). 3 drop-shaped thing, esp. A pendant or sweet. 4 curtain or scenery let down on to a stage. 5 (in pl.) Liquid medicine used in drops (eye drops). 6 minute quantity. 7 slang hiding-place for stolen goods etc. 8 slang bribe. v. (-pp-) 1 fall or let fall in drops, shed (tears, blood). 2 fall or allow to fall; let go. 3 a sink down from exhaustion or injury. B die. C fall naturally (drop asleep; drop into the habit). 4 a (cause to) cease or lapse; abandon. B colloq. Cease to associate with or discuss. 5 set down (a passenger etc.) (drop me here). 6 utter or be uttered casually (dropped a hint). 7 send casually (drop a line). 8 a fall or allow to fall in direction, amount, condition, degree, pitch, etc. (voice dropped; wind dropped; we dropped the price). B (of a person) jump down lightly; let oneself fall. C allow (trousers etc.) To fall to the ground. 9 omit (a letter) in speech (drop one's h's). 10 (as dropped adj.) In a lower position than usual (dropped handlebars; dropped waist). 11 give birth to (esp. A lamb). 12 lose (a game, point, etc.). 13 deliver by parachute etc. 14 football send (a ball), or score (a goal), by a drop-kick. 15 colloq. Dismiss or omit (dropped from the team).

the senses of egoism and egotism overlap, but egoism alone is used as a term in philosophy and psychology to mean self-interest (often contrasted with altruism).
n. 1 self-conceit. 2 selfishness.
see note at egoism.
n. Colloq. Activity to boost one's own self-esteem or self-conceit.
adj. 1 extremely bad. 2 archaic remarkable. [latin grex greg- flock]

A any more than the other (if you do not go, i shall not either). B moreover (there is no time to lose, either). [old english]

n. Colloq. Vigorous polishing; hard work.

n. (pl. -ies) berry of the elder tree.

adj. 1 of, worked by, or charged with electricity; producing or capable of generating electricity. 2 causing or charged with excitement. n. (in pl.) Colloq. Electrical equipment. [greek elektron amber]

prefix (also em- before b, p) forming verbs, = *in-2: 1 from nouns, meaning put into or on (engulf; entrust; embed). 2 from nouns or adjectives, meaning bring into the condition of (enslave); often with the suffix -en (enlighten). 3 from verbs: a in the sense in, into, on (enfold). B as an intensifier (entangle). [french en-, latin in-]
prefix (also em- before b, p) in, inside (energy; enthusiasm). [greek]
suffix forming verbs: 1 from adjectives, usu. Meaning make or become so or more so (deepen; moisten). 2 from nouns (happen; strengthen). [old english]

when ever is used with a question word for emphasis it is written separately (see sense 2). When used with a relative pronoun or adverb to give it indefinite or general force, ever is written as one word with the relative pronoun or adverb, e.g. However it's done, it's difficult.

adj. 1 lasting for ever or for a long time. 2 (of flowers) keeping their shape and colour when dried. n. 1 eternity. 2 everlasting flower.
